segment.source: BitLocker provides full volume encryption (FVE) for operating system volumes, as well as fixed and removable data volumes.
segment.target: BitLocker provides full volume encryption (FVE) for operating system volumes, as well as fixed and removable data volumes.

segment.source: To support fully encrypted operating system volumes, BitLocker uses an unencrypted system volume for the files required to boot, decrypt, and load the operating system.
segment.target: To support fully encrypted operating system volumes, BitLocker uses an unencrypted system volume for the files required to boot, decrypt, and load the operating system.

segment.source: This volume is automatically created during a new installation of both client and server operating systems.
segment.target: This volume is automatically created during a new installation of both client and server operating systems.

segment.source: In the event that the drive was prepared as a single contiguous space, BitLocker requires a new volume to hold the boot files.
segment.target: In the event that the drive was prepared as a single contiguous space, BitLocker requires a new volume to hold the boot files.

segment.source: Once a strong password has been created for the volume, a recovery key will be generated.
segment.target: Once a strong password has been created for the volume, a recovery key will be generated.

segment.source: The BitLocker Drive Encryption Wizard will prompt for a location to save this key.
segment.target: The BitLocker Drive Encryption Wizard will prompt for a location to save this key.

segment.source: A BitLocker recovery key is a special key that you can create when you turn on BitLocker Drive Encryption for the first time on each drive that you encrypt.
segment.target: A BitLocker recovery key is a special key that you can create when you turn on BitLocker Drive Encryption for the first time on each drive that you encrypt.

segment.source: You can use the recovery key to gain access to your computer if the drive that Windows is installed on (the operating system drive) is encrypted using BitLocker Drive Encryption and BitLocker detects a condition that prevents it from unlocking the drive when the computer is starting up.
segment.target: You can use the recovery key to gain access to your computer if the drive that Windows is installed on (the operating system drive) is encrypted using BitLocker Drive Encryption and BitLocker detects a condition that prevents it from unlocking the drive when the computer is starting up.

segment.source: A recovery key can also be used to gain access to your files and folders on a removable data drive (such as an external hard drive or USB flash drive) that is encrypted using BitLocker To Go, if for some reason you forget the password or your computer cannot access the drive.
segment.target: A recovery key can also be used to gain access to your files and folders on a removable data drive (such as an external hard drive or USB flash drive) that is encrypted using BitLocker To Go, if for some reason you forget the password or your computer cannot access the drive.

segment.source: You should store the recovery key by printing it, saving it on removable media, or saving it as a file in a network folder or on your OneDrive, or on another drive of your computer that you are not encrypting.
segment.target: You should store the recovery key by printing it, saving it on removable media, or saving it as a file in a network folder or on your OneDrive, or on another drive of your computer that you are not encrypting.

segment.source: You cannot save the recovery key to the root directory of a non-removable drive and cannot be stored on the encrypted volume.
segment.target: You cannot save the recovery key to the root directory of a non-removable drive and cannot be stored on the encrypted volume.

segment.source: You cannot save the recovery key for a removable data drive (such as a USB flash drive) on removable media.
segment.target: You cannot save the recovery key for a removable data drive (such as a USB flash drive) on removable media.

segment.source: Ideally, you should store the recovery key separate from your computer.
segment.target: Ideally, you should store the recovery key separate from your computer.

segment.source: After you create a recovery key, you can use the BitLocker control panel to make additional copies.
segment.target: After you create a recovery key, you can use the BitLocker control panel to make additional copies.

segment.source: When the recovery key has been properly stored, the BitLocker Drive Encryption Wizard will prompt the user to choose how to encrypt the drive.
segment.target: When the recovery key has been properly stored, the BitLocker Drive Encryption Wizard will prompt the user to choose how to encrypt the drive.

segment.source: There are two options:
segment.target: There are two options:

segment.source: Encrypt used disk space only - Encrypts only disk space that contains data
segment.target: Encrypt used disk space only - Encrypts only disk space that contains data

segment.source: Encrypt entire drive - Encrypts the entire volume including free space
segment.target: Encrypt entire drive - Encrypts the entire volume including free space

segment.source: It is recommended that drives with little to no data utilize the used disk space only encryption option and that drives with data or an operating system utilize the encrypt entire drive option.
segment.target: It is recommended that drives with little to no data utilize the used disk space only encryption option and that drives with data or an operating system utilize the encrypt entire drive option.

segment.source: Note: Deleted files appear as free space to the file system, which is not encrypted by used disk space only.
segment.target: Note: Deleted files appear as free space to the file system, which is not encrypted by used disk space only.

segment.source: Until they are wiped or overwritten, deleted files hold information that could be recovered with common data forensic tools.
segment.target: Until they are wiped or overwritten, deleted files hold information that could be recovered with common data forensic tools.

segment.source: Selecting an encryption type and choosing Next will give the user the option of running a BitLocker system check (selected by default) which will ensure that BitLocker can properly access the recovery and encryption keys before the volume encryption begins.
segment.target: Selecting an encryption type and choosing Next will give the user the option of running a BitLocker system check (selected by default) which will ensure that BitLocker can properly access the recovery and encryption keys before the volume encryption begins.

segment.source: It is recommended to run this system check before starting the encryption process.
segment.target: It is recommended to run this system check before starting the encryption process.

segment.source: If the system check is not run and a problem is encountered when the operating system attempts to start, the user will need to provide the recovery key to start Windows.
segment.target: If the system check is not run and a problem is encountered when the operating system attempts to start, the user will need to provide the recovery key to start Windows.

segment.source: After completing the system check (if selected), the BitLocker Drive Encryption Wizard will restart the computer to begin encryption.
segment.target: After completing the system check (if selected), the BitLocker Drive Encryption Wizard will restart the computer to begin encryption.

segment.source: Upon reboot, users are required to enter the password chosen to boot into the operating system volume.
segment.target: Upon reboot, users are required to enter the password chosen to boot into the operating system volume.

segment.source: Users can check encryption status by checking the system notification area or the BitLocker control panel.
segment.target: Users can check encryption status by checking the system notification area or the BitLocker control panel.

segment.source: Until encryption is completed, the only available options for managing BitLocker involve manipulation of the password protecting the operating system volume, backing up the recovery key, and turning BitLocker off.
segment.target: Until encryption is completed, the only available options for managing BitLocker involve manipulation of the password protecting the operating system volume, backing up the recovery key, and turning BitLocker off.
